column4: Hey guys have they fixed the annoyances with installing kde alongside gnome, kinda like some kde logos/screens etc override the system?
As of earlier this week, I believe "no"
I was helping somebody sort out a problem where we had installed gnome desktop and then they wanted kde, then they upgraded to karmic.
and kxm and gdm were fighting, so they could'nt use xdmcp.
thank you
So, I'm not certainyl what problems exactly you were worried about, but it appears that one isn't solved yet.
CTRL+ALT+DEL to bring up the shutdown menu. Choose suspend.
That only gives me "log out" and "Switch usre"
What version of Ubuntu?
ALT+F1 over to system, prefs, keyboard shortcuts. Set your own keystroke for suspend.
Ah,http://www.objectivistcenter.org/cth--1782-blink_think.aspx neat.
Did I miss something? Whats the article?
Which?
linuxguy2009: Ah,http://www.objectivistcenter.org/cth--1782-blink_think.aspx neat.
Oops, sorry, that was a miskey.  Interesting review, though.
hehe thats ok
Dangit, the suspend doesn't appear to work. Hm.
What did you set the shortcut to?
alt-pause.
try another one besides pause maybe unusable. Try something simple first to see if it works. Then change it later.
ctrl+alt+s for example
